headline: Opinions about the long term reliability of Rust's ecosystem
description:
There're many discussions about language design. I think most of us agree that Rust does many things right in this regard.

Still, a holistic view needs to take other aspects into account. One is the long term reliability of the ecosystem regarding language changes but most importantly regarding the required third party libraries.

Do you have concerns, experiences, opinions about this? Did you chose another language because some of your required third party dependencies are still on version 0.x or depend on a single person or don't seem to get updated frequently?
